intro: Babiana velutina var. nana, commonly known as the dwarf babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Its ornamental value and ease of cultivation make it a popular choice among gardeners.
